official-title.#text: To prohibit Federal funding of foreign travel by the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency until the Agency conducts public listening sessions on rulemaking targeting carbon dioxide emissions from existing power plants in each of the 15 States with the highest percentage of electricity generated by coal in 2012.

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committees on
, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: Listen to Americans First Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency

text.#text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, no Federal funds may be obligated or expended for any travel outside of the United States or its territories by the

header.#text: No foreign travel until public listening sessions are conducted in States that rely on coal

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: conducts public listening sessions on rulemaking targeting carbon dioxide emissions from existing power plants in each of the 15 States with the highest percentage of electricity generated by coal in 2012 (West Virginia, Kentucky, Wyoming, Indiana, Missouri, North Dakota, Utah, Nebraska, New Mexico, Ohio, Colorado, Kansas, Iowa, Montana, and Wisconsin); and
